definition: to lose one's head/to be out of one's mind/to be dazed
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head

sentences.english: I was confused by all the noise.
sentences.chinese: 一片嘈雜聲把我弄得昏頭昏腦。

sentences.english: The manager busied himself all day and got addle brained.
sentences.chinese: 這位經理整天忙得昏頭昏腦。

sentences.english: Miguel is a young Colombian politician blinded by his own privilege.
sentences.chinese: 米格爾是個被特權衝昏頭腦的哥倫比亞政治家。

sentences.english: The dizzy driver, figuring that the policeman wasn't coming back to him, drove home.
sentences.chinese: 昏頭昏腦的紳士認爲警察不會回來了，就開車回家了。

sentences.english: He is carried away by his own success.
sentences.chinese: 他被自己的成就衝昏頭腦。

sentences.english: Here is the kind of reasoning in which people get bogged down.
sentences.chinese: 這種矛盾的推理會將人們搞得昏頭轉向嗎？絲毫不會。

sentences.english: He blew his mind out in a car. He didn't notice that the lights had changed.
sentences.chinese: 他在車裏昏頭了，他“居然”沒注意到燈號已經變了。

sentences.english: Sir, you've gone mad with power!
sentences.chinese: 先生，您被權力衝昏頭腦了。

sentences.english: After a couple of wines my head felt all muzzy.
sentences.chinese: 喝了兩杯酒就昏頭昏腦的了。

sentences.english: She has not allowed success to turn her head.
sentences.chinese: 她沒有讓成功衝昏頭腦。

sentences.english: Because you might get carried away.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你可能會被它衝昏頭腦。

sentences.english: I'm not getting carried away with it, only the media will.
sentences.chinese: 我不會被聯賽盃冠軍而衝昏頭腦，只有媒體會。

sentences.english: He is puzzled by a rain of questions.
sentences.chinese: 一連串的問題弄得他昏頭昏腦。

sentences.english: We all felt under the weather the morning after New Year's Eve.
sentences.chinese: 在除夕隔夜的早晨，我們都覺得昏頭昏腦的很不舒服。

sentences.english: The tumor presses on the skull, poor girl, and makes her groggy.
sentences.chinese: 那快腫瘤壓迫着腦殼，可憐的姑娘，叫她昏頭漲腦的。

sentences.english: You must be crazy. Your uncle doesn't go to nightclubs.
sentences.chinese: 你一定昏頭了，你叔叔沒有去過夜總會。
